snippet: A customer turned to the Haggler after prepaying for cellphone minutes — without knowing that there was a 90-day deadline for using them.
abstract: David Segal The Haggler column; customer of TracFone turns to the Haggler after prepaying for cellphone minutes--without knowing that there was a 90-day deadline for using them.
lead_paragraph: A customer turned to the Haggler after prepaying for cellphone minutes — without knowing that there was a 90-day deadline for using them.

headline.print_headline: The Minutes Were Prepaid, but the Grief Was Free
headline.seo: Cellphone Minutes Were Prepaid, but the Grief Was Free
headline.main: The Minutes Were Prepaid, but the Grief Was Free
